title: PTD Today — Media
disclaimer: Informational only — AI-generated summaries; may contain errors. Verify with the original video.

items.title: Audyt w erze AI: praktyczne zastosowania i realne korzyści | Katarzyna Chojniak, Alicja Barska

ai.summary: Based on the available description… AI is presented as a current, practical element of audit work in a KPMG ON AIR podcast where Katarzyna Chojniak and Alicja Barska describe how AI supports repetitive tasks, large-population analysis and decision-making. They outline concrete tools (AI Transaction Scoring Tool, Clara AI and KPMG Clara/Clara for Clients), benefits for clients, changing auditor competencies, and implementation, security and regulatory challenges.
bullets: AI moves audit from sampling to full-population analysis using tools like AI Transaction Scoring.
Clara AI provides conversational assistance and specialized agents to support auditors.
KPMG Clara platform enables real-time audit management; Clara for Clients modernizes client communication.
AI aids documentation and disclosure analysis, improving efficiency and insights for clients.
Implementation challenges include auditor adaptation, data security and regulatory considerations.
takeaways: Prioritize data security and compliance when hosting or sharing audit datasets — regulatory and security concerns are highlighted as key challenges.
Expect demand for real-time data access and integration (KPMG Clara) to support continuous audit processes and client communication.
Plan for full-population analytics capabilities and associated data-handling workflows rather than relying solely on sampling.
Invest in staff upskilling and change management to adapt auditor roles and tools effectively.

items.title: AI at Speed: From Investment to Performance

ai.summary: Based on the available description… PwC US Senior Partner and CEO Paul Griggs speaks with CNBC’s Emma Crosby at the 2026 World Economic Forum in Davos about the shift from AI exploration to execution. They emphasize evaluating AI through investment discipline, measurable performance, and building operating models that remain resilient without sacrificing outcomes as AI delivers measurable value today and supports future transformation.
bullets: AI evaluation is shifting from experimentation to investment discipline and measurable performance.
Leading organizations move early and place capital with clear intent.
Operating models are being redesigned for resilience while maintaining performance.
AI is already delivering measurable outcomes that support transformation.
Discussion originates from PwC and CNBC coverage at the 2026 Davos forum.
takeaways: Prioritize AI investments that demonstrate measurable value and clear ROI before scaling.
Allocate capital intentionally to projects that can scale and align with long-term infrastructure needs.
Design operating models that preserve resilience (e.g., reliability/uptime) while improving performance.
Leverage AI not just for experimentation but to drive operational efficiencies and future-proof data center and grid capabilities.

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Copilot provides real-time visual support for home projects and repairs by "seeing" what you see and delivering step-by-step instructions. It offers clear guidance for common issues such as leaky pipes and overflowing washing machines.
bullets: Real-time support for home projects and repairs
Copilot can see what you see (visual awareness)
Provides step-by-step instructions
Examples include plumbing (leaky pipes) and appliance issues (overflowing washing machines)
Emphasizes clear, actionable guidance
takeaways: Visual, real-time troubleshooting could be applied to on-site facility and equipment maintenance workflows
Step-by-step guidance can help standardize repair procedures for technicians
Remote visual assistance may reduce the need for specialist travel and speed problem resolution
Clear, actionable instructions can lower the risk of misdiagnosis during urgent maintenance

items.title: Arknights: Endfield | 4K NVIDIA DLSS 4 Launch Trailer

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Arknights: Endfield has officially launched and the game features NVIDIA DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation. The launch trailer was captured on a GeForce RTX 5080 at 4K Ultra settings using DLSS 4 Multi Frame Generation 4X Mode.
bullets: Arknights: Endfield is a newly launched 3D real-time strategy RPG.
The game includes NVIDIA DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation.
Trailer capture: GeForce RTX 5080, 4K Ultra settings, DLSS 4 MFG 4X Mode.
Official links provided for the DLSS 4 announcement and the game website.
Social channels for Arknights: Endfield and NVIDIA GeForce are listed.
takeaways: DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation is being adopted in new game releases—verify DLSS 4 support and deployment plans for relevant GPU fleets.
Trailer was captured on an RTX 5080 at 4K Ultra with MFG 4X—confirm compatibility and driver/firmware readiness for RTX 50-series hardware.
For streaming or demo environments, ensure NVIDIA DLSS 4-capable drivers and software are available to reproduce marketed visuals.

items.title: Rate Insurance Boosts Agent Efficiency with Agentforce and Gemini

ai.summary: Based on the available description, the video shows how Rate Insurance boosts agent efficiency using Agentforce and Gemini within the Google Cloud and Salesforce partnership. Viewers are directed to a link for more information about that partnership.
bullets: Highlights Rate Insurance improving agent efficiency
Features Agentforce and Gemini as the showcased tools
Frames the solution within a Google Cloud + Salesforce partnership
Provides a link for more information about the partnership
takeaways: If evaluating vendor tools for agent productivity, note Agentforce and Gemini are presented as solutions to explore
Consider cloud + CRM partnerships (Google Cloud and Salesforce) when sourcing integrated agent-support technologies
Use the provided partnership link to gather further technical and commercial details before procurement
Look for similar video case studies to assess operational fit and expected efficiency gains

items.title: I Travel The World And Live Rent-Free By Pet Sitting Full Time

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Charly Stoever, a 35-year-old financial coach, has spent the last 18 months living out of two suitcases while pet sitting full time and living rent-free in Portland, Oregon. She brings in about $60,000 a year, and the story is part of CNBC Make It's Millennial Money series.
bullets: Charly Stoever, 35, is a financial coach who pet sits full time.
Lives rent-free in Portland by house/pet sitting.
Has been living out of two suitcases for the past 18 months.
Earns approximately $60,000 per year from this arrangement.
Piece produced for CNBC Make It's Millennial Money series (producer: Lauren Shamo; reporter: Ryan Ermey).
takeaways: Mobile, location-independent work like full-time pet sitting can generate a stable income, indicating demand for platforms that support such gig roles.
Consistent earnings from nontraditional gigs imply back-end needs for payment processing, scheduling, and user profiles—areas where scalable infrastructure matters.
A visible lifestyle story on a major outlet may drive increased traffic to consumer-facing gig platforms, affecting capacity and availability planning.
Decision-makers should note the growing segment of digital-first, travel-friendly workers when forecasting bandwidth and service reliability requirements.

items.title: New CO2 Battery Stores 8 Hours of Energy

ai.summary: Based on the available description, this giant bubble of carbon dioxide can store 20 megawatts of energy. The technology is presented as a way to help manage fluctuations in renewable generation and to support the global shift to clean energy.
bullets: Giant bubble of CO2 serves as an energy storage medium.
Storage capacity cited as 20 megawatts.
Designed to address variability in renewable energy supply.
Positioned to help power the global transition to clean energy.
takeaways: 20 MW capacity indicates potential relevance for grid-scale balancing or large-facility energy needs.
Technology is framed to help manage renewable variability—consider it when planning renewable integration.
Relevant to long-term decarbonization strategies due to its stated global focus.
Decision-makers should seek further technical and deployment details (duration, efficiency, costs) to assess practical fit.

items.title: AI w cenach transferowych – jak wykorzystać jej potencjał? | Monika Palmowska, Jakub Roszkiewicz

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Monika Palmowska and Jakub Roszkiewicz discuss how AI is already influencing transfer pricing—supporting profitability monitoring, benchmark analyses and automation of documentation—and argue it will strengthen rather than replace tax advisors. The episode also addresses implementation steps, integration with ERP and intelligent benchmarks, data/security risks (including RODO and hallucinations) and secure workspaces like Digital Gateway.
bullets: AI use cases: monitoring rentowności, porównawcze analizy i automatyzacja dokumentacji cen transferowych.
AI jako wsparcie doradców podatkowych — nie zastąpi, ale zwiększy efektywność i rozwój kompetencji młodszych pracowników.
Główne ryzyka: dane, bezpieczeństwo, RODO oraz ryzyko 'halucynacji' modeli.
Bezpieczne środowisko: Digital Gateway jako rozwiązanie do pracy z AI.
Wdrożenie: uporządkowanie procesów jako fundament, integracja z ERP i inteligentne benchmarki; wskazane pierwsze kroki i persony.
takeaways: Prioritize data governance and GDPR compliance before deploying AI tools to handle transfer-pricing data.
Evaluate secure environments (e.g., Digital Gateway) to mitigate security and privacy risks when using AI.
Plan integration with existing ERP systems and intelligent benchmarking to gain operational value from AI.
Treat AI as an augmentation tool: invest in staff upskilling and clear personas to maximize adoption.
Start transformation by streamlining processes—clean processes are the foundation for reliable AI implementations.
